channel.title: Introduction :: CIS 526 Textbook
channel.description: Node is an open-source, cross-platform JavaScript runtime environment build on Google’s V8 engine. It was created by Ryan Dahl in 2009 to allow for server-side scripting in JavaScript. ECMAScript Support Node supports most of the features of ECMAScript 2015 (ES6), with the notable exception of ES6 modules (as Node adopted the CommonJS module approach before the ES6 proposal, and the two approaches are not interchangeable). You can learn more about Node’s ES6 support here.
